name: Badiaga
Relationship: Complementary: Sulph.; Merc.; Iod.Compare: Merc. similar but opposite modalities. Spongia; Kali-hyd.; Phytol.; Conium.

Heart: Indescribable bad feeling about the heart with soreness and pain, flying stitches all over
Eyes: Twitching of left upper lid; eyeballs tender; aching in eyeballs
Intermittent sore pain in eyeball, coming on at three pm
Respiratory: Whooping-cough, with thick yellow expectoration; flies out
Cough; worse in afternoon, better in warm room
The mucus flies out of mouth and nostrils
Pleuritic stitches in chest, neck, and back
Stomach: Lancinating pain in pit of stomach extending to vertebra and scapula
Head: Slight sounds are greatly accentuated
Dull, dizzy feeling in head
Sensation of enlargement and fullness
Pain in forehead and temple, extending to eyeballs, worse in afternoon
Blueness under eyes
Influenza
Dandruff; scale sore, dry, tetter-like
Coryza, sneezing, watery discharge, with asthmatic breathing and suffocative cough
Back: Muscles and skin sore, as if beaten
Pain in small of back, hips and lower limbs
Female: Metrorrhagia; worse at night, with feeling of enlargement of head

details: Soreness of muscles and integuments; worse motion and friction of clothes, with sensitiveness to cold. Glands swollen. General paresis. Basedow's disease. Lues, bubo, roseola.
